repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Public Enterprise Reform Loan
            (PERL) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Enterprise Reform
            Loan (PERL) Project for Uruguay were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: a) in countries like Uruguay, a broad
            political consensus is also needed in addition to the
            political commitment of the Borrower. Government commitment
            clearly was present in the case of PERL, but it was not
            enough. This illustrates one of the reasons that structural
            reform in the past in Uruguay has been slower than in many
            other Latin American countries involving contentious
            changes. In addition, the commitment to public enterprises
            (PE) reform has particularly to be present in the management
            of PEs being targeted for restructuring or privatization; b)
            Borrowers and the Bank tend to over estimate the capacity to
            absorb technical assistance and this appears to have been
            the case with PERL. Even in the context of a project with a
            sound administrative structure, there is frequently limited
            capacity, for example, to hire all the service providers
            required for a large list of project components, especially
            with a rigorous implementation program plan; and c) this
            project's experience jibes with the indications from
            other Bank activities in Uruguay that the process of making
            sensitive policy changes in countries which depends on the
            attainment of broad consensus can be exceedingly slow paced,
            and may not be greatly influenced by the choice of lending instruments.

5082219.trustfund: TF020625-PHRD-PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM PROJ.,TF021412-PHRD-PUBLIC ENTERPRISE REFORM/PRIVATIZATION,TF020710-SPANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Enterprise Reform Loan (PERL)
            will support the Government's efforts to improve
            services and reduce the size of the public sector, under a
            transparent and competitive process, focusing on
            telecommunications, transport, and power. In the
            telecommunications sector the project will prepare and
            diagnose a strategic plan for the restructuring of the
            sector and design a regulatory framework for
            telecommunications and set-up a regulatory entity as well as
            privatize the telecommunications enterprise. In the
            transport sector the project will review and revise the
            Aviation Code to facilitate private sector participation and
            it will audit and privatize the State Aviation Company. The
            project will also implement a new regulatory framework for
            ports, including implementation of the new organization of
            the National Port Entity, develop operational methods and
            procedures for the port, including coordination with private
            operators. In the power sector the project will develop a
            regulatory framework to allow private operators within the
            national power system and establish a regulatory commission
            for power, also the project will study privatization options
            and subsequent implementation strategy for the State Power
            Entity's selected generation plants. The project will
            also provide assistance for reforming the Ministry of
            Agriculture, preparing a diagnosis of the State Petroleum,
            Alcohol and Cement Entity's cement and alcohol plants,
            and peripheral privatizations of public entities such as
            local airports and ambulance services.
